meanings.definition: The transmission of a disease from one person to another by direct or indirect contact.
meanings.sent1: The contagion of the flu quickly spread through the school.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained how contagion occurs through touching contaminated surfaces.
meanings.sent3: The idea of wearing socks with sandals spread like a contagion among the fashion-forward crowd.
meanings.sent4: Gossip can be a contagion, infecting minds and spreading like wildfire.
meanings.sent5: The contagion of fear gripped the town as rumors of a monster circulated.

meanings.definition: The spreading of a harmful idea or practice.
meanings.sent1: The contagion of negativity in the office affected everyone's mood.
meanings.sent2: The contagion of fake news on social media can be damaging to society.
meanings.sent3: The contagion of dad jokes at the party had everyone groaning and laughing at the same time.
meanings.sent4: The contagion of procrastination can be hard to shake off once it takes hold.
meanings.sent5: The contagion of kindness can create a ripple effect of positivity in the community.
